king.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a man who rules a country because he is from a royal family
king.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: On 2 December Henry VI was crowned king (=made the king at an official ceremony).
king.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if you live like a king, feel like a king etc, you are very successful, happy, rich etc
king.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: With her at my side, I felt like a king.
king.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: the most important piece in chess
king.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a playing card with a picture of a king on it
king.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1 : a man who rules a country because he is from a royal family
king.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: Prince Charles will become king when his mother, Queen Elizabeth, dies.
He was crowned king upon the death of his father.
The Spanish king was deposed in 1931.
How could a Christian king rule if he was banned from the Church?
It shocked the nation when the king abdicated.
The Duke of Gloucester claimed that he was the rightful king.
She married the future king of France, Philip Augustus.
They were fighting out of loyalty to their king.
The new laws were very unpopular with the king’s subjects.
king.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: king
the male ruler of a country, who comes from a royal family
George III was the king of England at that time.
King Harald V of Norway
queen
a woman who rules a country because she is from a royal family, or the wife of a king
She became queen when she was only 14 years old.
Queen Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom
monarch
a king or queen
The bishops were appointed by the monarch.
monarchy
a country that is ruled by a king or queen, or this type of political system
Britain is a constitutional monarchy.
Some people want the monarchy to be abolished.
prince
the son of a king, queen, or prince, or the male ruler of a small country or state
Prince Rainier of Monaco
The prince will inherit the throne when his father dies.
ruler
someone such as a king, who has official power over a country and its people
the ruler of Babylonia
General Musharraf was the former military ruler of Pakistan.
emperor
the ruler of an empire (=group of countries)
the Habsburg emperors of the 19th century
Emperor Hirohito
sovereign
a king or queen
It was hoped that a meeting of the two sovereigns would ease tensions between the countries.
regent
someone who governs instead of a king or queen, because the king or queen is ill, absent, or still a child
Edward II left his friend Gaveston as regent.
the crown
the position of king or queen
Warwick was a loyal servant of the crown.
king.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: Elvis Presley; an informal name still used for the famous singer, especially by people who love his music
king.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if something is king, it is the most important thing and has a strong influence on people’s decisions
king.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: We were convinced of the superiority of our product, but ultimatelythe customer is king and it was rejected.
Mr Smith suggests thatcash is king and that readers should look to the health of a company’s cash flow.
king.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: someone who is very influential or successful in a particular area
king.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Even the supermarket kings were nervous about the recession.
